function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Fragmented digital technologies may not effectively address contemporary problems created by the pandemic.","Impact":"Ineffective response to the pandemic, leading to continued spread of contagious diseases and negative social and economic impacts.","Mitigation":"Integration of digital transformation technologies to create a more effective and dynamic healthcare system.","Technologies":"Integrated IoT, blockchain, open-source technologies, and data integration solutions.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and economic stakeholders.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, government agencies, and technology developers."},{"Description":"Failure to build a critical mass of engaged users for digital contact tracing apps.","Impact":"Highly inaccurate results and ineffective tracing of contagious diseases, leading to continued spread of the disease.","Mitigation":"Providing immediate value to smaller communities to increase user engagement, and offering incentives for adoption in larger communities. Consideration of cultural context and effective management of social implications.","Technologies":"Blockchain-based infrastructures, IoT, and incentive mechanisms for user engagement.","People":"General population, public health agencies, and technology developers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, technology developers, and community leaders."},{"Description":"Lack of adoption and trust in the proposed digital transformation framework architecture.","Impact":"Limited effectiveness in alleviating the COVID-19 outbreak and mitigating the social and economic impacts of the pandemic.","Mitigation":"Building incentive mechanisms to encourage adoption, considering cultural context to minimize user resistance, and effectively managing the social implications of the framework.","Technologies":"Blockchain-based infrastructures, IoT, open-source technologies, and data integration solutions.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and economic stakeholders.","Owner":"Technology developers, healthcare organizations, and government agencies."}]}
